00010 //  See http://www.boost.org/libs/type_traits for most recent version including documentation.
00011 
00012 //    Fixed is_pointer, is_reference, is_const, is_volatile, is_same, 
00013 //    is_member_pointer based on the Simulated Partial Specialization work 
00014 //    of Mat Marcus and Jesse Jones. See  http://opensource.adobe.com or 
00015 //    http://groups.yahoo.com/group/boost/message/5441 
00016 //    Some workarounds in here use ideas suggested from "Generic<Programming>: 
00017 //    Mappings between Types and Values" 
00018 //    by Andrei Alexandrescu (see http://www.cuj.com/experts/1810/alexandr.html).
00019 
00020 
00021 #ifndef BOOST_TT_IS_SAME_HPP_INCLUDED
00022 #define BOOST_TT_IS_SAME_HPP_INCLUDED
00023 
00024 #include "boost/type_traits/config.hpp"
00025 #ifdef BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_PARTIAL_SPECIALIZATION
00026 #include "boost/type_traits/detail/yes_no_type.hpp"
00027 #include "boost/type_traits/detail/ice_and.hpp"
00028 #include "boost/type_traits/is_reference.hpp"
00029 #endif
00030 // should be the last #include
00031 #include "boost/type_traits/detail/bool_trait_def.hpp"
00032 
00033 namespace boost {
00034 
00035 #ifndef BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_PARTIAL_SPECIALIZATION
00036 
00037 BOOST_TT_AUX_BOOL_TRAIT_DEF2(is_same,T,U,false)
00038 BOOST_TT_AUX_BOOL_TRAIT_PARTIAL_SPEC2_1(typename T,is_same,T,T,true)
00039 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(__BORLANDC__, < 0x600)
00040 // without this, Borland's compiler gives the wrong answer for
00041 // references to arrays:
00042 BOOST_TT_AUX_BOOL_TRAIT_PARTIAL_SPEC2_1(typename T,is_same,T&,T&,true)
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #else // BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_PARTIAL_SPECIALIZATION
00046 
00047 namespace detail {
00048 
00049 #ifdef BOOST_MSVC
00050 // the following VC6 specific implementation is *NOT* legal
00051 // C++, but has the advantage that it works for incomplete
00052 // types.
00053 
00054 template< typename T1 >
00055 struct is_same_part_1
00056 {
00057     template<typename T2>  struct part_2     { enum { value = false }; };
00058     template<>             struct part_2<T1> { enum { value = true }; };
00059 };
00060 
00061 template< typename T1, typename T2 >
00062 struct is_same_impl
00063 {
00064     enum { value = detail::is_same_part_1<T1>::template part_2<T2>::value };
00065 };
00066 
00067 #else // generic "no-partial-specialization" version
00068 
00069 template <typename T>
00070 ::boost::type_traits::yes_type
00071 BOOST_TT_DECL is_same_tester(T*, T*);
00072 
00073 ::boost::type_traits::no_type
00074 BOOST_TT_DECL is_same_tester(...);
00075 
00076 template <typename T, typename U>
00077 struct is_same_impl
00078 {
00079    static T t;
00080    static U u;
00081 
00082    BOOST_STATIC_CONSTANT(bool, value =
00083       (::boost::type_traits::ice_and<
00084          (sizeof(type_traits::yes_type) == sizeof(detail::is_same_tester(&t,&u))),
00085          (::boost::is_reference<T>::value == ::boost::is_reference<U>::value),
00086          (sizeof(T) == sizeof(U))
00087         >::value));
00088 };
00089 
00090 #endif // BOOST_MSVC
00091 
00092 } // namespace detail
00093 
00094 BOOST_TT_AUX_BOOL_TRAIT_DEF2(is_same,T,U,(::boost::detail::is_same_impl<T,U>::value))
00095 
00096 #endif // BOOST_NO_TEMPLATE_PARTIAL_SPECIALIZATION
00097 
00098 } // namespace boost
00099 
00100 #include "boost/type_traits/detail/bool_trait_undef.hpp"
00101 
00102 #endif  // BOOST_TT_IS_SAME_HPP_INCLUDED
